duck: Brotulas are a family, Bythitidae, of ophidiiform fishes, also known as viviparous brotulas as they bear live young.

'Brotulas' are a family, 'Bythitidae', of ophidiiform fishes, also known as
'viviparous brotulas' as they bear live young. They are found in tropical and
subtropical waters throughout the world. They are small fishes, around to in
length, and live in surface waters or around reefs.<ref name=EoF></ref>

A few species are freshwater: for example, the Mexican blind brotula, Ogilbia
pearsei, is found in caves and sinkholes in the Yucatán Peninsula, Mexico.

Since 2002, more than 110 new species have been added to this family.<ref>http:-
//researcharchive.calacademy.org/research/ichthyology/catalog/SpeciesByFamily.a-
sp</ref> In 2005, 26 new species were described in a single paper by Danish and
German scientists<ref name=SMN2005></ref> and in 2007, an additional 8 new
genera with 20 new species were described in another paper by the same
scientists.<ref name=20new></ref>
